definition: tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: I still get stuck on the different tones.
sentences.chinese: 我对那些不同的声调还是很不熟。

sentences.english: Each pair there would have identical pitch.
sentences.chinese: 每一双都会发出同样的声调。

sentences.english: Bend degree is a basic unit to measure tonal arch degree.
sentences.chinese: 折度是计量声调曲拱的基本单位。

sentences.english: The musician can discriminate minute variations in tone.
sentences.chinese: 乐师能辨别声调的各种细微变化。

sentences.english: A single-syllable word can have several meanings depending on how it is intoned .
sentences.chinese: 一个单音节的字，依声调的不同，可以有几种意思。

sentences.english: Yangping and Shang tone's tone sandhi can be considered the same.
sentences.chinese: 阳平和上声的声调变化却几乎一样。

sentences.english: Tone: Tones sre pitch variations, which are caused by the differing rates of vibration of the vocal cords.
sentences.chinese: 声调是由于声带振动的速率的不同而引起的音高变化。

sentences.english: My favorite music is the babble of strange tongues in the marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜爱的音乐就是广场上用奇怪的声调发出的生意。

sentences.english: The tone pattern of Chinese trisyllabic words are more complicated.
sentences.chinese: 汉语三字词的声调模式是复杂的。

sentences.english: The effect of the vibrations is similar to that of high-pitched noise shattering glass.
sentences.chinese: 振动的作用与高声调噪声粉碎玻璃相类似。

sentences.english: Voice conversion experiments are performed to evaluate the tone codebook mapping algorithm.
sentences.chinese: 声音转换实验评估了声调码本映射算法的性能。

sentences.english: Don't just pay attention to words. Note the speaker's tone of voice and body language to get the full meaning.
sentences.chinese: 而要留心讲者的声调和肢体语言以听取完整的涵意。

sentences.english: Chinese is a language with syllabic tone.
His words were intoned with suspect.
sentences.chinese: 他的话语有一种怀疑的声调。

sentences.english: "Rahul, " she implores in a stifled tone.
The main suprasegmental features include stress, tone and intonation.
sentences.chinese: 主要的超切分特征包括重音，语调和声调。

definition: pitch of voice (high or low)/pitch (of a musical note)/tone
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
final sound of a syllable/rhyme (e.g. in European languages)
high-pitched and penetrating (musical instrument, voice etc)/high-spirited/fever-pitched (atmosphere)
